Package com.example.qrapp

Class MapFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.qrapp.MapFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
    public class MapFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    This is a class that extends the Fragment class. This "MapFragment" class contains and maintains the data that will be displayed on the map

      This method returns true if a given distance is less than a given threshold

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapFragment

        public MapFragment()
        A constructor for the MapFragment. This sets the majority of the relevant attributes for the Map Fragment. This allows for the passing of any surplus data to the Fragment to use without needing to have knowledge of the source

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        @Nullable
public android.view.View onCreateView​(@NonNull
                                      android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        The onCreateView method sets critical view parameters for the MapFragment such as the display of Nearby Codes and the Update button. With user permission, Location updates begin as soon as the view is created
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater -
        container -
        savedInstanceState -
        Returns:
        View

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        The onDestroy method is called when the MapFragment is destroyed. This method stops getting location updates before the MapFragment is destroyed
        Overrides:
        onDestroy in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

      • startLocUpdates

        private void startLocUpdates()
        This method keeps a live update of the user's current location. This information is used to determine the closest codes in the area

      • stopLocUpdates

        private void stopLocUpdates()
        This method stops keeping a live update of the user's location. This is used when a MapFragment reaches the end of its lifecycle

      • showMapFragment

        private void showMapFragment()
        This method initializes the HelperMapFragment to display the appropriate information on a map for the user to see

      • addLocationsToMap

        private void addLocationsToMap()
        This method adds the nearest codes to the user's determined location as data to be displayed on the map

      • updateView

        private void updateView()
        This method updates the view of the number of codes nearests to the user

      • inRange

        private boolean inRange​(double threshold,
                        double wantsIn)
        This method returns true if a given distance is less than a given threshold
        Parameters:
        threshold - the bounding distance
        wantsIn - the distance being compared
